name: Time Traveller
description: Time Traveller is a text adventure with graphics. Someone has broken Father Time's magic hourglass and you eventually have to restore it. But first things first - as the game starts you wake up in 1990 with no idea who, where, or when you are, or how you got there. You need to figure out how to time travel in order to set things right.
gamePlay: Graphic adventure, Interactive fiction / text adventure

shot.caption: Tijdreiziger - Title Screen (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - Your start in the "Slaapzaal". Like any graphical text adventures you have to use text commands (now in Dutch) to control characters and influence the environment. (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - The name on the identeitskaart is: DRJ! And that stands for Doctor John! He is better known as John Vanderaart! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - When you type 'Kijk' you'll get a description of the room and if there are items to be found. This, and when you drop an item, are the ONLY ways to make these items appear! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - Now that you have fixed the accus and filled the teleporter, it is time to do some time travelling! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - The computer tells you that the teleporter must ALWAYS be charged! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - These are the times that you can travel to from the present. (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - The manual tells you again about your mission. (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - We are going back in time!!! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - And returning to the present! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - In the year 2090..if Man is still alive! If Women can survive. They may find.... (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - Type 'b' and you'll know what you have in your bezit/inventory. (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - Encountering a robot in the future! (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - IF you do not know what to do next, you always can type 'help' to get the next hint (Dutch)
Tijdreiziger - 'speel cassette' and you'll hear commercials about two other games that were made by John Vanderaart! (Dutch)
Title Screen (English)
Introduction with some explanation about some verbs that you can use! (English)
Interestingly enough, if you choose to ask for 'help' at the start of the game, it will say this! (English)
There is some pretty interesting information on the wall that will give you an important clue! (English)
If you look out of the port-hole in the Navigation-room you will see a Planet. (English)
The teleporter needs to be charged all the time, IF you want to make use of it! (English)
Reading the Manual! (English)
IF you type "direction" it will tell you which way(s) you can go to. (English)
"i" will bring up your Inventory. (English)
In the English version you only will hear a commercial announcement about the game called "Magic Stone" if you play the cassette! (English)
Title Screen. (French)
Your starting location! (French)
Interesting! English sentences in the FRENCH version of the game! (French)
Examiner the room for items! (French)
Tells you that the Teleporter ALWAYS needed to charged if you want to time travel! (French)
The manual. (French)
Back in time to the year 1890. (French)
And into the future. (French)
Finding some rope. (French)
A Forge of the blacksmith. (French)
At a lake in the past. (French)
In this version you only will hear a commercial announcement about the game called "Pierre Magique" that was created by John Vanderaart and published by Micro Application. (French)
